results.title: Aucassin and Nicolette
results.creator_credit: Guy Glover, ONF | NFB and Lotte Reiniger
results.brief_description: An animated medieval fantasy, a delightful silhouette film, with colour background by master German animator Lotte Reiniger. Set against a background of castles and forest with Renaissance style music this enchanting tale recounts the love story of Aucassin and Nicolette.

results.title: Attitudes are everything
results.creator_credit: Institute of Educational Administration and Peter Brighton
results.brief_description: A young boy is integrated into a primary school in the Dandenongs. He suffers from chronic tuberous sclerosis and his disabilities include lack of speech and motor dysfuntion of the hands. This video reflects the change in his mother’s attitude as he progresses in his school life. Indicates how integration can be a most positive achievement for all those concerned given a sympathetic and helpful environment.

results.title: Attitude gyro
results.creator_credit: Audio Productions and Sperry Gyroscope Co
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the Sperry attitude gyro in action in a P-47 fighter. Explains that this aeronautical instrument provides a visual indication of the position of an aircraft, with reference to the earth’s surface, throughout all possible attitudes in when a plane can be manoeuvred. The instrument is adaptable to other types of aircraft.

results.title: Attic of the wind (K)
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: What happens to the things that blow away? Like the bubbles you blew on a sunny day? Where do they all go, anyway? To the attic of the wind. The lost treasures of childhood are not really lost but are stored away, along with the rest of the world’s lost treasures in the Attic of the Wind. Delicate, dream-like artwork and music combine to create a fantasy world where the past is always fresh and the magic of childhood never fades. Based on the book by Doris Herold Lund, illustrated by Ati Forberg. Photography by Alexander Cochran.

results.title: Atoms and starlight
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
The use of spectroscopy and spectrum analysis have been vital when astronomers study the stars. The continous, emission and dark-line spectra have enabled scientists to determine the composition of stars and to modify the original classification of stars. Atoms of elements have their own unique “fingerprint’ spectrum which can be determined by studying the behaviour of photons and electrons. With the advances in fibre optics, spectographs can now measure many stars instead on one, and thus determine the nature of a group of celestial bodies within a galaxy.

results.title: Atoms and molecules
results.brief_description: Sir Lawrence Bragg describes and illustrates the structure of atoms and molecules, demonstrates their size and the progressive development of microscopic instruments and techniques, and performs experiments showing the wetting of oil molecules and the Brownian movement. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Atomic physics: an historical approach
results.brief_description: A five part series designed for use in agencies teaching advanced physics. This series traces the development of atomic energy from when John Dalton forwarded his atomic energy theory in 1808. Through reconstruction and interviews, the scientists Dalton, Faraday, Rutherford, Cockcroft, Frisch and Einstein are introduced. Each part of the series is usable independently.
